message: Absolutely, I should say. Why doesn't everyone just arrive with a single malt. Or, we can take a field trip to a local liquor store to establish stocks. I'd recommend we also have stocks of bottled water, as hotel water isn't always great (though I didn't notice anything wrong with the Hyatt's water last year).
Or just order on the Internet for delivery to my suite ... :-)
Discuss.
If complete scotch noobs are allowed and it didn't conflict with other BOFs I want to attend, I'd totally come.

@holdenweb Excellent.  I'd like to suggest going to a liquor store further outside of the downtown area.  The one across the street from the Hyatt was ridiculously expensive when we visited last year.
@benjaminws Are you saying a liquor store across from a major convention hotel was overpriced? because I NEVER
Maybe we could hire a minivan with driver or something like that. We should ask locals for advice - maybe Brandon Craig-Rhodes?
@bitprophet I know, right?!  Whoda thunk it??
Green's is the semi-official liquor store of PyATL. http://maps.google.com/maps?ie=UTF8&hl=en&cid=7239836391381154485&sll=33.778906,-84.382422&sspn=0.017051,0.059701&hq=&hnear=&z=16&iwloc=A
of course, for those traveling by air, all liquids must be consumed before leaving Atlanta... what a problem to have! ;)
Although we meet at a restaurant/bar now, so don't make bulk purchases as often as before.
I think this is possibly the best idea for a BoF I've ever heard.
Well, all liquids that you bring with you. It's super-cheap to upgrade to business class on AirTrain where you get free booze! (Well, last year anyway, dunno now that they're owned by Southwest...)
@benjaminws That directions link made my eyes cross.
Green's only a few minutes from the Hyatt: http://is.gd/bVq9E3
Is it me, or do google maps urls look like Perl one liners?
The selection in the special cooler is outstanding.
Sorry I can't join :(
@doughellmann For everyones sake, I'm fixing that.
@alex there are no laws at pycon
best idea of the whole conference
Green's is indeed an EXCELLENT choice, especially for Scotch and/or Cognac fans.
Mmmm, bourbon.
I'd prefer single
I'm currently enjoying Maker's 46, Woodford Reserve Maple Wood Finish, Black Maple Hill, and Booker's.
I've got some 4 Roses single barrel that would be very nice :) But it's cask strength (104 proof), so we'll need some good water.
+1 on the Bourbon.
is this for both blendeds and single-malts? I'm kind of a single-malt d00d.
Can it be a whiskey BoF? I'd love to bring some good Bourbon.
@pmclanahan of course, I think its overrated. Good, but not my favorite.
I'm in NC though, and all our liquor stores are state owned/run, so we never get anything interesting.
fair enough
@cleverdevil nice. I love Woodford in general.
And by enjoying, I mean "running out of".
Not sure if it's up to date, but I found Green's list of single malt specials: http://www.greensbeverages.com/singlemalt.pdf
Definitely need to include Bourbon. I love Scotch, but this is AMERICA PEOPLE.
I highly recommend Noahs Mill
I've been trying to find some Pappy Van Winkle, but have failed so far.
@cleverdevil exactly! AMERICA (fuck yeah)! It's the national beverage people :)
@cleverdevil I've been wanting to try the Woodford Maple. How is it?
@pmclanahan its epic. But, expensive.
@pmclanahan there is a great bottle shop near my house in Atlanta that carries it.
I live amongst all of the bourbon distilleries and will be bringing a nice selection with me to PyCon. I hope my liver survives.
We're driving down so we'll be bringing a nice carload of options.

depends on how much drinking will take place :P

These would be the deluxe glasses that can not only hold scotch but also bourbon or even rye.
